III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility Requirements
Section (2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a youth is
Description placed in independent living:
(c) That the youth’s social service worker has personally
observed and determined that the living situation is safe and that
the youth has a bed and has access to cooking and bathing
facilities.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth alleged being raped.
Investigation I interviewed Administrator 1 virtually on 04/05/2023.
Administrator 1 stated Youth A had truanted the facility in early
March and was admitted to a hospital for psychiatric services
before returning to the facility. Administrator 1 described Youth A
sexually reactive at the hospital and Youth A reportedly made
advances to officers while at the hospital. Administrator 1 stated
Youth A was briefly returned to the facility/program after being
discharged from the hospital. Administrator 1 stated the agency
submitted a 30 notice for Youth A to be released from their
program due to Youth A not being appropriate for their
independent living program and requiring more intensive mental
health services. Administrator 1 stated the supervision of Youth A
was transferred to another agency, and Youth A was
subsequently placed with a grandparent.
Administrator 1 submitted incident reports dated 01/28/2023,
02/13/2023, 02/28/2023, 03/01/2023, 03/16/2023, and other
documentation related to Youth A's placement with their agency.
The additional information submitted included a staffing schedule,
safety plan for Youth A dated 3/14/2023, 30-day notice for the
removal of Youth A dated 03/10/2023, 5 incident reports, daily log
notes, and eight social work contacts from 03/06/2023 to
04/03/2023. None of the information documented indicated Youth
A could/would have been raped while at the facility. It was noted
in a social work contact dated 4/03/2023 Youth A did report to
Foster Care Worker 1 the allegation that Youth A was raped in
Flint. This would have occurred during a truancy and not while at
the facility as the facility of Youth A's placement is not in Flint.
Other social work contacts and information reviewed indicate
Youth A reported both consensual and nonconsensual sexual
activity during a truancy. The closest identification provided by
2

Youth A was that Youth A was raped by a homeless man at an
MTA bus station in Flint.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 by telephone on 05/15/2023
and 05/23/2023. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth A was
incarcerated for felonious assault. Foster Care Worker 1 saw
Youth A on 05/16/2023 and reported Youth A did not provide any
additional information related to this allegation. Foster Care
Worker 1 described Youth A as not being credible and requiring
more mental health services. Foster Care Worker 1 stated Youth
A has a court hearing at a yet to be determined time. Foster Care
Worker 1 stated Youth A's attorney was requesting Youth A have
a mental health evaluation to determine competency prior to
Youth A's next court hearing.
Analysis The findings of this investigation do not support the allegation that
Youth A was raped while at this facility. Youth A has a
documented history of mental health disorders and possible
substance abuse. There is the possibility that Youth A could have
been raped by someone while Youth A was truant from the facility
or that someone could have taken advantage of Youth A during
Youth A's truancy due to Youth A's mental condition. However,
there is no evidence to suggest/support an allegation Youth A was
raped by anyone associated with this independent living program.
There was nothing revealed in this investigation to indicate that
the youth’s living environment was not safe as required by the
rule. Further upon determining that independent living was not the
best plan for this youth, the agency gave a 30-day notice and the
youth was replaced.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
